newsitem.title: UK: NWE gasoline rallies with crude, awaits NYMEX lead.
newsitem.headline: NWE gasoline rallies with crude, awaits NYMEX lead.

text.p: NWE gasoline edged higher with crude oil but traders awaited direction from the NYMEX after a U.S. refinery fire on Tuesday and before key weekly inventory data.
Traders were also closely watching the arbitrage after some gasoline was pulled out of NWE this month when U.S. prices rallied sharply.
An explosion and fire rocked Tosco Corp's 150,000 barrel per day Avon refinery in northern California.

The company said the fire was at a hydrocracker unit that makes gasoline. Some units were already down for maintenance before the fire and other units not affected by the fire were still operating, it said.
"The gasoline (increase on ACCESS) does not necessarily reflect the Tosco fire," cautioned one barge trader.
Eurograde barges rose $4 to $217/$219 fob ARA, with trades heard at $218 and $218.50. Regular unleaded rose a similar amount to $$210/$212.
"We've withdrawn from the market especially after news of the Japanese selling gasoline," the trader said. "We're waiting for the APIs."
American Petroleum Institute data was delayed one day, to later Wednesday, due to the U.S. Martin Luther King holiday.

Earlier, in Asia, gasoline prices fell after aggressive selling from a Japanese trader who lowered an offer for 50,000 barrels of 92-octane unleaded gasoline from $2.05 a barrel fob Singapore to $24.50.
